alert.note: Alert for Clay; Norman; West Marshall; West Polk; Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 12 at 2:09PM CST until December 14 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 11 inches and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Minnesota and northeast and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL INFORMATION...The highest ice accumulations are expected to be in southeastern North Dakota, where up to two tenths of an inch is possible, mainly before Tuesday midday. Heaviest snowfall rates will be during the day Tuesday into Tuesday evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Norman; West Marshall; West Polk; Wilkin
